sentence.Network_en: The furniture was threadbare; he'd obviously picked it up for nothing.
sentence.Network_cn: 这件家具很破旧，显然他是白捡来的了。

sentence.Network_en: The carpets had worn rather threadbare.
sentence.Network_cn: 地毯已磨得相当破旧了.

list.abs: having many worn or threadbare spots in the nap ., 细毛上有很多污点或污斑.

12. threadbare: wore out; in bad condition 破旧的;陈腐的 e.g. threadbare rugs 衣衫褴褛 threadbare excuses 陈腐的借口 Structure of the Text Part One.

entry.tran: (衣服、地毯等)破旧的，磨薄的，陈旧的
entry.def: Threadbare clothes, carpets, and other pieces of cloth look old, dull, and very thin, because they have been worn or used too much.

example.ex: She sat cross-legged on a square of threadbare carpet.
example.tran: 她盘腿坐在一块破旧的方形地毯上。

entry.tran: (活动、想法、论点)无力的，不充分的，陈旧乏味的
entry.def: If you describe an activity, an idea, or an argument as threadbare, you mean that it is very weak, or inadequate, or old and no longer interesting.

means.word_mean: 1. repeated too often; overfamiliar through overuse;
2. having the nap worn away so that the threads show through;

auth_sentence.content: The clothes that wrapped his diminutive body were threadbare.

auth_sentence.content: He likes driving it wearing his threadbare sports clothes.
